Columns.Description: Hard coded- 'OpsManager'.
Columns.Name: SourceSystem

Columns.Description: Event collection time in UTC.
Columns.Name: TimeGenerated

Columns.Description: The time at which the event related to the activity was received. Different then the 'Timegenerated' field, which is when the event was recieved in the log collector machine.
Columns.Name: ReceiptTime

Columns.Description: String that together with device product and version definitions, uniquely identifies the type of sending device.
Columns.Name: DeviceVendor

Columns.Description: String that together with device product and version definitions, uniquely identifies the type of sending device.
Columns.Name: DeviceProduct

Columns.Description: String or integer that serves as a unique identifier per event type.
Columns.Name: DeviceEventClassID

Columns.Description: A string or integer that describes the importance of the event. Valid string values:Unknown,Low,Medium,High,Very-High Valid integer values are:0-3= Low,4-6= Medium,7-8= High,9-10= Very-High.
Columns.Name: LogSeverity

Columns.Description: A non-mapped version of LogSeverity. For example: Warning/Critical/Info insted of the normilized Low/Medium/High in the LogSeverity Field
Columns.Name: OriginalLogSeverity

Columns.Description: The action mentioned in the event.
Columns.Name: DeviceAction

Columns.Description: A mapped version ofDeviceAction, such asDenied>Deny.
Columns.Name: SimplifiedDeviceAction

Columns.Description: Host, from Syslog.
Columns.Name: Computer

Columns.Description: Any information about the direction the observed communication has taken. Valid values:0= Inbound, 1= Outbound.
Columns.Name: CommunicationDirection

Columns.Description: The facility generating the event. For example: auth or local1.
Columns.Name: DeviceFacility

Columns.Description: Destination port. Valid values:0-65535.
Columns.Name: DestinationPort

Columns.Description: The destination IpV4 address that the event refers to in an IP network.
Columns.Name: DestinationIP

Columns.Description: The IPv4 address of the device generating the event.
Columns.Name: DeviceAddress

Columns.Description: The FQDN associated with the device node, when a node is available. For example:host.domain.comorhost.
Columns.Name: DeviceName

Columns.Description: A message that gives more details about the event.
Columns.Name: Message

Columns.Description: Transport protocol that identifies the Layer-4 protocol used. Possible values include protocol names, such asTCPorUDP.
Columns.Name: Protocol

Columns.Description: The source port number. Valid port numbers are0-65535.
Columns.Name: SourcePort

Columns.Description: The source that an event refers to in an IP network, as an IPv4 address.
Columns.Name: SourceIP

Columns.Description: The remote IP address, derived from the event's direction value, if possible.
Columns.Name: RemoteIP

Columns.Description: The remote port, derived from the event's direction value, if possible.
Columns.Name: RemotePort

Columns.Description: If one of the IP in the message was correlate with the current TI feed we have it will show up here.
Columns.Name: MaliciousIP

Columns.Description: The threat severity of the MaliciousIP according to our TI feed at the time of the record ingestion.
Columns.Name: ThreatSeverity

Columns.Description: The threat type of the MaliciousIP according to our TI feed.
Columns.Name: IndicatorThreatType

Columns.Description: The threat description of the MaliciousIP according to our TI feed.
Columns.Name: ThreatDescription

Columns.Description: The threat confidence of the MaliciousIP according to our TI feed.
Columns.Name: ThreatConfidence

Columns.Description: Link to the report of the TI feed.
Columns.Name: ReportReferenceLink

Columns.Description: The Longitude of the MaliciousIP according to the GEO information at the time of the record ingestion.
Columns.Name: MaliciousIPLongitude

Columns.Description: The Latitude of the MaliciousIP according to the GEO information at the time of the record ingestion.
Columns.Name: MaliciousIPLatitude

Columns.Description: The country of the MaliciousIP according to the GEO information at the time of the record ingestion.
Columns.Name: MaliciousIPCountry

Columns.Description: String that together with device product and version definitions, uniquely identifies the type of sending device.
Columns.Name: DeviceVersion

Columns.Description: A string that represents a human-readable and understandable description of the event.
Columns.Name: Activity

Columns.Description: A placeholder for additional fields. Fields are logged as key-value pairs.
Columns.Name: AdditionalExtensions

Columns.Description: The protocol used in the application, such as HTTP, HTTPS, SSHv2, Telnet, POP, IMPA, IMAPS, and so on.
Columns.Name: ApplicationProtocol

Columns.Description: A count associated with the event, showing how many times the same event was observed.
Columns.Name: EventCount

Columns.Description: The DNS part of the fully-qualified domain name (FQDN).
Columns.Name: DestinationDnsDomain

Columns.Description: The service that is targeted by the event. For example:sshd.
Columns.Name: DestinationServiceName

Columns.Description: Identifies the translated destination referred to by the event in an IP network, as an IPv4 IP address.
Columns.Name: DestinationTranslatedAddress

Columns.Description: Port after translation, such as a firewall Valid port numbers:0-65535.
Columns.Name: DestinationTranslatedPort

Columns.Description: The DNS domain part of the full qualified domain name (FQDN).
Columns.Name: DeviceDnsDomain

Columns.Description: A name that uniquely identifies the device generating the event.
Columns.Name: DeviceExternalID

Columns.Description: The interface on which the packet or data entered the device. For example: ethernet1/2.
Columns.Name: DeviceInboundInterface

Columns.Description: The Windows domain of the device address.
Columns.Name: DeviceNtDomain

Columns.Description: Interface on which the packet or data left the device.
Columns.Name: DeviceOutboundInterface

Columns.Description: Unique identifier for the payload associated with the event.
Columns.Name: DevicePayloadId

Columns.Description: Process name associated with the event. For example: in UNIX, the process generating the syslog entry.
Columns.Name: ProcessName

Columns.Description: Identifies the translated device address that the event refers to, in an IP network. The format is an Ipv4 address.
Columns.Name: DeviceTranslatedAddress

Columns.Description: The destination that the event refers to in an IP network. The format should be an FQDN associated with the destination node, when a node is available. For example:host.domain.comorhost.
Columns.Name: DestinationHostName

Columns.Description: The destination MAC address (FQDN).
Columns.Name: DestinationMACAddress

Columns.Description: The Windows domain name of the destination address.
Columns.Name: DestinationNTDomain

Columns.Description: The ID of the destination process associated with the event.
Columns.Name: DestinationProcessId

Columns.Description: Defines the destination use's privileges. Valid values:Admninistrator,User,Guest.
Columns.Name: DestinationUserPrivileges

Columns.Description: The name of the events destination process, such astelnetdorsshd.
Columns.Name: DestinationProcessName

Columns.Description: Timezone of the device generating the event.
Columns.Name: DeviceTimeZone

Columns.Description: Identifies the destination user by ID. For example: in Unix, the root user is generally associated with the user ID 0.
Columns.Name: DestinationUserID

Columns.Description: Identifies the destination user by name.
Columns.Name: DestinationUserName

Columns.Description: The MAC address of the device generating the event.
Columns.Name: DeviceMacAddress

Columns.Description: Defines the ID of the process on the device generating the event.
Columns.Name: ProcessID

Columns.Description: The time at which the activity related to the event ended.
Columns.Name: EndTime

Columns.Description: An ID used by the originating device. Typically, these values have increasing values that are each associated with an event.
Columns.Name: ExternalID

Columns.Description: Time when the file was created.
Columns.Name: FileCreateTime

Columns.Description: Hash of a file.
Columns.Name: FileHash

Columns.Description: An ID associated with a file, such as the inode.
Columns.Name: FileID

Columns.Description: Time when the file was last modified.
Columns.Name: FileModificationTime

Columns.Description: Full path to the file, including the filename. For example:C:\ProgramFiles\WindowsNT\Accessories\wordpad.exeor/usr/bin/zip.
Columns.Name: FilePath

Columns.Description: The file's permissions. For example: '2,1,1'.
Columns.Name: FilePermission

Columns.Description: File type, such as pipe, socket, and so on.
Columns.Name: FileType

Columns.Description: The file's name, without the path.
Columns.Name: FileName

Columns.Description: The size of the file in bytes.
Columns.Name: FileSize

Columns.Description: Number of bytes transferred inbound.
Columns.Name: ReceivedBytes

Columns.Description: Time when the old file was created.
Columns.Name: OldFileCreateTime

Columns.Description: Hash of the old file.
Columns.Name: OldFileHash

Columns.Description: And ID associated with the old file, such as the inode.
Columns.Name: OldFileID

Columns.Description: Time when the old file was last modified.
Columns.Name: OldFileModificationTime

Columns.Description: Name of the old file.
Columns.Name: OldFileName

Columns.Description: Full path to the old file, including the filename. For example:C:\ProgramFiles\WindowsNT\Accessories\wordpad.exeor/usr/bin/zip.
Columns.Name: OldFilePath

Columns.Description: Permissions of the old file. For example: '2,1,1'.
Columns.Name: OldFilePermission

Columns.Description: The size of the old file in bytes.
Columns.Name: OldFileSize

Columns.Description: File type of the old file, such as a pipe, socket, and so on.
Columns.Name: OldFileType

Columns.Description: Number of bytes transferred outbound.
Columns.Name: SentBytes

Columns.Description: The URL accessed for an HTTP request, including the protocol. For example:http://www/secure.com.
Columns.Name: RequestURL

Columns.Description: The user agent associated with the request.
Columns.Name: RequestClientApplication

Columns.Description: Describes the content from which the request originated, such as the HTTP Referrer.
Columns.Name: RequestContext

Columns.Description: Cookies associated with the request.
Columns.Name: RequestCookies

Columns.Description: The method used to access a URL. Valid values include methods such asPOST,GET, and so on.
Columns.Name: RequestMethod

Columns.Description: Identifies the source that event refers to in an IP network. Format should be a fully qualified domain name (DQDN) associated with the source node, when a node is available. For example:hostorhost.domain.com.
Columns.Name: SourceHostName

Columns.Description: Source MAC address.
Columns.Name: SourceMACAddress

Columns.Description: The Windows domain name for the source address.
Columns.Name: SourceNTDomain

Columns.Description: The DNS domain part of the complete FQDN.
Columns.Name: SourceDnsDomain

Columns.Description: The service responsible for generating the event.
Columns.Name: SourceServiceName

Columns.Description: Identifies the translated source that the event refers to in an IP network.
Columns.Name: SourceTranslatedAddress

Columns.Description: Source port after translation, such as a firewall. Valid port numbers are0-65535.
Columns.Name: SourceTranslatedPort

Columns.Description: The ID of the source process associated with the event.
Columns.Name: SourceProcessId

Columns.Description: The source user's privileges. Valid values include:Administrator,User,Guest.
Columns.Name: SourceUserPrivileges

Columns.Description: The name of the event's source process.
Columns.Name: SourceProcessName

Columns.Description: The time when the activity that the event refers to started.
Columns.Name: StartTime

Columns.Description: Identifies the source user by ID.
Columns.Name: SourceUserID

Columns.Description: Identifies the source user by name. Email addresses are also mapped into the UserName fields. The sender is a candidate to put into this field.
Columns.Name: SourceUserName

Columns.Description: Event type. Value values include: 0: base event, 1: aggregated, 2: correlation event, 3: action event. Note: This event can be omitted for base events.
Columns.Name: EventType

Columns.Description: The name of the table
